instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.message:
Hi guys.

I have this A1707 powering on and I get only backlight. No liquid, no burned parts, and no shorted lines on the LCD circuit. I noticed on the EDP_INT lines I have only 0.4v, how much it should have? I haven't tried another LCD, waiting for new stock of those models lcd. I have PP3V3_S0SW_LCD 3v, PP5V_S0SW_LCD 5v... 

I suspect U9850, but before i go ahead and change it, any ideas?

Test with known good LCD assembly first.
A1706/8 models should serve for test.

Did you check USB activity and external video?
I just received a new LCD, and it shows an image with it. Maybe an LCD flex cable issue?

A problem with any video flex from display assembly, should still show image; with stripes, flickering lines.
The problem can be on the T-CON board, or LCD itself.
Yes, i thought so after checking the flex and it's all good. I'll offer a new LCD :) Thank you very much
